title: New Zealand 22-0 Ireland LIVE score: TV channel and try updates from Rugby World Cup quarter-final
text:
Ireland face a huge test at the hands of favourites New Zealand in their Rugby World Cup 2019 quarter-final.

Joe Schimdt's side are looking to reach their first ever World Cup semi-final but must overcome the feared All Blacks in Tokyo.

Ireland have won two of their last three clashes with the defending champions but are huge underdogs against a side who have not lost a World Cup game since their 2007 quarter-final against France.

Ireland had to settle for second place in Pool A after a shock defeat to Japan, handing them a feared quarter-final draw.

Rob Kearney and Peter O'Mahony are back in the starting line-up for Schmidt's side with Garry Ringrose partnering Robbie Henshaw at centre behind half-back duo Conor Murray and Johnny Sexton.

Ireland: Kearney; Earls, Ringrose, Henshaw, Stockdale; Sexton, Murray; Healy, Best, Furlong, Henderson, James Ryan, O'Mahony; Van der Flier, Stander.

Replacements: Scannell, Kilcoyne, Porter, Beirne, Ruddock, McGrath, Carbery, Larmour.

New Zealand: B Barrett; Reece, Goodhue, Lienert-Brown, Bridge; Mo'unga, Smith; Moody, Taylor, Laulala, Retallick, Whitelock; Savea, Cane, Reid.

Replacements: Coles, Tuungafasi, Ta'avao, S Barrett, Todd, Perenara, Williams, J Barrett.
description: Ireland are bidding to reach their first ever Rugby World Cup quarter-final against defending champions New Zealand
